issue.title: dzen.ru

labels.name: Extra
labels.description: Issues, related to AdGuard Extra extension

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

---

### Внимание

Эта проблема решается с помощью расширения [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra).

Если вы используете AdGuard для Windows, Mac или Android, пожалуйста, убедитесь, что AdGuard Extra включен в настройках программы.

Если вы используете браузерное расширение AdGuard, мы рекомендуем установить AdGuard Extra в дополнение к нему.

* [Установить в Chrome, Edge или другой браузер на основе Chromium](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Установить в Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

comment.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/131315#issuecomment-1267675568 - To raczej nie jest problem związany z filtrami (nie potrafię tego odtworzyć w wersji 4.1.36).
Wygląda na to, że w wersji eksperymentalnej (MV3) część reguł może być zbyt późno "uruchamiana", więc z tego powodu te reklamy nie są blokowane.
Prawdopodobnie zostanie to naprawione w którejś z kolejnych wersji rozszerzenia.

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);

- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Browser Extension

### AdGuard version

4.1.19

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T1mj8-NTW0o

### What filters do you have enabled?

Legitimate URL Shortener

Send Do-Not-Track signals

issue.title: 💡 Add a user-specific adjustable global filter system.
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Hi, filter rules are reaching 100k, 200k and more number of filters day by day, it is very dysfunctional to have this many filter number of rules for 1 user. In the other words it's like, impossible for 1 user to visit all websites. So I have a suggestion about it and i would like to report this suggestion for you devs.

### Proposed solution

This suggestion is:

**User-specific global filter list system**. (I think it would be better if this list was separate from the existing user rules.)

By the way, for this system, getting data directly from the server and processing at the same time for such a number of users may be under heavy load for server, I don't know. You devs know what is best.

So is something like this possible?:

Some kind of caching of the AdGuard global filter on user devices. So global filter list on the server > Global filter cache update on users devices > user specific filter list made by client. The goal here is to convert server processes to > client processes. The server just updates the cache global filter list. The point here is that it is set by the Adguard client with the global filter in the cache to set the user specific filter rules.

With 2 option settings in AdGuard client:

**Automatic**:

Automatic adding from the global filter list in the cache for the user's custom filter list for sites visited by users.

**Manual**:

Manual adding from on global filter list cache for sites visited by user with the client.

Like this suggestion it probably won't pass the 10k number of filter rules for the user-specific. In this case, it can save a huge load in terms of performance for devices.

### Additional information

As end user, i feel that such a suggestion is not possible according to the filter rule structure. Still, I think it's better than nothing in terms of information. I like to thank you for interest in advance.

comment.body: Users visit not limited number of sites, and visit new sites every day.

issue.title: www.bricodepot.ro
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

Ublock Origin with AdGuard Annoyance

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

www.bricodepot.ro

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Annoyances filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

After I open the website, a grey window appear.

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body: @Sergey-Lyapin Sorry to disturb you again but I see that cookie pop-up again. I use Firefox 105.0.2 with Ubock Origin 1.44.4, all filters are up-to-date using "Purge all caches". I asked on ublock github page and they found a fix: add `/gdprcookie/*` as filter, and it worked.

comment.body:
@Alex-302 будет создан бесплатный аккаунт, можно проверить в бесплатной версии:

1. Зайти на https://play.geforcenow.com/
2. В правом верхнем углу нажать на `Join`
3. Дальше нужно будет войти/зарегистрировать аккаунт Nvidia или в сервисе партнере, который работает в стране
4. После регистрации открыть https://play.geforcenow.com/games?game-id=cb2b1b5f-54ba-45fd-9839-96bbfe1376cd
5. Выбрать Steam или Origin (неважно что)
6. Затем нажать `Play`

-----

Когда нажимаю `Play`, в консоли не появляются ошибки. При выборе магазина появляются такие ошибки:
```
https://userstore.nvidia.com/v1/clientData?key=platform_preference&value=%7B%22cb2b1b5f-54ba-45fd-9839-96bbfe1376cd%22:%22100272911%22%7D&value=%7B%22cb2b1b5f-54ba-45fd-9839-96bbfe1376cd%22:%22100901811%22%7D
https://userstore.nvidia.com/v1/clientData?key=platform_preference&value=%7B%22cb2b1b5f-54ba-45fd-9839-96bbfe1376cd%22:%22100272911%22%7D&value=%7B%22cb2b1b5f-54ba-45fd-9839-96bbfe1376cd%22:%22100901811%22%7D
```

И если получится, то было бы неплохо, чтобы вы сами воспроизвели проблему, так как мне кажется запросов выше будет недостаточно.

issue.title: 💡 Add a user-specific adjustable global filter system.
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Hi, filter rules are reaching 100k, 200k and more number of filters day by day, it is very dysfunctional to have this many filter number of rules for 1 user. In the other words it's like, impossible for 1 user to visit all websites. So I have a suggestion about it and i would like to report this suggestion for you devs.

### Proposed solution

This suggestion is:

**User-specific global filter list system**. (I think it would be better if this list was separate from the existing user rules.)

By the way, for this system, getting data directly from the server and processing at the same time for such a number of users may be under heavy load for server, I don't know. You devs know what is best.

So is something like this possible?:

Some kind of caching of the AdGuard global filter on user devices. So global filter list on the server > Global filter cache update on users devices > user specific filter list made by client. The goal here is to convert server processes to > client processes. The server just updates the cache global filter list. The point here is that it is set by the Adguard client with the global filter in the cache to set the user specific filter rules.

With 2 option settings in AdGuard client:

**Automatic**:

Automatic adding from the global filter list in the cache for the specific-user custom filter list for sites visited by user.

**Manual**:

Manual adding with the client from the global filter list in the cache for the specific-user custom filter list for sites visited by user.

Like this suggestion it probably won't pass the 10k number of filter rules for the user-specific. In this case, it can save a huge load in terms of performance for devices.

### Additional information

As end user, i feel that such a suggestion is not possible according to the filter rule structure. Still, I think it's better than nothing in terms of information. I like to thank you for interest in advance.

comment.body: But performance is not affected if you enabled 5-7 filters(or even all, if your device is not 10 years old:) )

### Внимание

Эта проблема решается с помощью расширения [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra).

Если вы используете AdGuard для Windows, Mac или Android, пожалуйста, убедитесь, что AdGuard Extra включен в настройках программы.

Если вы используете браузерное расширение AdGuard, мы рекомендуем установить AdGuard Extra в дополнение к нему.

* [Установить в Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)
